intro: Gypsophila dshungarica, commonly known as the Mongolian baby's breath, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or pink flowers bloom in summer, adding a soft, ethereal appearance to its habitat. Gypsophila dshungarica is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its aesthetic appeal and resilience.
